events.text: After Gandalf had left, Analexius woke up alone in the Great Hall with the deceased Bug King.
He was shocked to see the towering deceased body of the bug king.

Furious at being left behind and wanting to release his anger, he began kicking the Bug King's body. 
The citizens, drawn by the loud noise that the bug king lets out before dying, tracked the dead bugs along the roads of Objecthia, to the Great Hall. When they arrived, they entered the Great Hall out of curiosity.
They saw the Bug King, dead, and witnessing Analexius "fighting" the corpse, they assumed he had killed the Bug King.

Overjoyed, the citizens praised Analexius, lifting him into the air and celebrating their new hero. Analexius, 
not knowing what really happened, accepted their praise with a sheepish grin, realizing his accidental heroism had finally come true once again.

Meanwhile, after everyone had left the Great Hall of Objectification, Gandalf returned alone, still holding the IDE Tome securely. 
He gazed down at the fallen Bug King and murmured ancient incantations, weaving powerful magic around the creature's lifeless form.
With each word, a surge of energy revitalized the Bug King, restoring its malevolent presence.

As Gandalf completed his spell, he sensed the dark aura of the Bug King returning to life. He quickly exited the Great Hall,
 sealing the doors behind him. The Bug King stirred, its crimson eyes flickering back to life as it slowly regained consciousness.
